src.camera.SuncgCameraSampler module¶

class src.camera.SuncgCameraSampler.SuncgCameraSampler(config)[source]¶

Bases: src.camera.CameraSampler.CameraSampler

Samples valid camera poses inside suncg rooms.

Works as the standard camera sampler, except the following differences: - Always sets the x and y coordinate of the camera location to a value uniformly sampled inside a rooms bounding box - The configured z coordinate of the configured camera location is used as relative to the floor - All sampled camera locations need to lie straight above the room’s floor to be valid

See parent class CameraSampler for more details.

_find_floor(room_obj)[source]¶

Returns the floor object of the given room object.

Goes through all children and returns the first one with type “Floor”.

Parameters:room_obj – The room object.
Returns:The found floor object or None if none has been found.
_insert_key_frames(cam, cam_ob, frame_id)[source]¶

Insert key frames for all relevant camera attributes.

Parameters:
  • cam – The camera which contains only camera specific attributes.
  • cam_ob – The object linked to the camera which determines general properties like location/orientation
  • frame_id – The frame number where key frames should be inserted.
_is_pose_valid(floor_obj, cam, cam_ob, cam2world_matrix)[source]¶

Determines if the given pose is valid.

  • Checks if the pose is above the floor
  • Checks if the distance to objects is in the configured range
  • Checks if the scene coverage score is above the configured threshold
Parameters:
  • floor_obj – The floor object of the room the camera was sampled in.
  • cam – The camera which contains only camera specific attributes.
  • cam_ob – The object linked to the camera which determines general properties like location/orientation
  • cam2world_matrix – The sampled camera extrinsics in form of a camera to world frame transformation matrix.
Returns:

True, if the pose is valid
run()[source]¶
sample_and_validate_cam_pose(cam, cam_ob, config)[source]¶

Samples a new camera pose, sets the parameters of the given camera object accordingly and validates it.

Parameters:
  • cam – The camera which contains only camera specific attributes.
  • cam_ob – The object linked to the camera which determines general properties like location/orientation
  • config – The config object describing how to sample
Returns:

True, if the sampled pose was valid
